original_title: Hackaday Podcast Episode 272: Desktop EDM, Silence of the Leaves, and the Tyranny of the Rocket Equation
original_content:
With Elliot off on vacation, Tom and Dan made a valiant effort to avoid the dreaded clip show and provide you with the tastiest hacker treats of the week. Did they succeed? Thats not for us to say, but if youre interested in things like non-emulated N64 games and unnecessarily cool filament sensors, this just might be one to check out.
We also came across a noise suppressor for a leaf blower, giant antennae dangling from government helicopters, and a desktop-friendly wire EDM setup that just might change the face of machining. We waxed on about the difference between AI-generated code and just pulling routines from StackExchange, came to the conclusion that single-stage-to-orbit is basically just science fiction, and took a look at the latest eclipse from 80,000 feet, albeit a month after the fact.

title: 自作N64ゲームの静音化：NetBSDがAI生成コードを規制
body: Elliot不在でTomとDanがエピソードを制作。AIコードBanやN64ゲーム再生、葉っぱ除去機のノイズ抑制、80,000フィートからの日食撮影など話題。HacksやQuick Hacksも。iTunesやSpotifyでPodcast配信。
titles: 自作N64ゲームの静音化：NetBSDがAI生成コードを規制
デスクトップ用のWire EDMセットアップが登場：Bettaの新製品
WiFiフィラメントセンサーの革新
超高層からの日蝕撮影
ラズベリーパイPicoでバドミントンラケットを張り替え
